This is a list of experimental features that you can enable. These features are still under development; they are not fully tested, and might reduce EUR-Lex stability. Don't forget to give your feedback! Warning! Experimental feature conflicts detected. Replacement of CELEX identifiers by short titles - experimental feature. It replaces clickable CELEX identifiers of treaties and case-law by short titles. Visualisation of document relationships. It displays a dynamic graph with relations between the act and related documents. It is currently only available for legal

name: direct-access.html
text: Experimental feature conflicts detected. Replacement of CELEX identifiers by short titles - experimental feature. It replaces clickable CELEX identifiers of treaties and case-law by short titles. Visualisation of document relationships. It displays a dynamic graph with relations between the act and related documents. It is currently only available for legal acts. Deep linking. It enables links to other legal acts referred to within the documents. It is currently only available for documents smaller than 900 KB. Use the Advanced search Help Export PDF Print Access the Official Journal Official Journal L series daily view Official Journal C series daily view Browse the Official Journal Legally binding printed editions Special editions Access the Official Journal By date range Calendar Calendar By OJ reference Year All OJ series All Number of the Official Journal Recent issues Results 1 - 220 of 220 Date L (Legislation) C (Information and Notices) 20/05/2025 Display 23 acts Display 13 acts 19/05/2025 Display 17 acts Display 109 acts 16/05/2025 Display 12 acts Display 13 acts 15/05/2025 Display 11 acts Display 6 acts 14/05/2025 Display 7 acts Display 9 acts Results 1 - 220 of 220 The Official Journal of the European Union is the official publication (gazette) for EU legal acts, other acts and official information from EU institutions, bodies, offices and agencies. It is published from Monday to Friday – and in urgent cases on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays – in the official languages of the EU at the time of publication, currently numbering 24.

name: direct-access.html
text: for EU legal acts, other acts and official information from EU institutions, bodies, offices and agencies. It is published from Monday to Friday – and in urgent cases on Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays – in the official languages of the EU at the time of publication, currently numbering 24. EUR-Lex contains the electronic version of all the Official Journals going back to 30 December 1952 when the first Official Journal of the European Coal and Steel Community was published. Following the entry into force of the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community and the Treaty establishing the European Atomic Energy Community in 1958, the Official Journal of the European Communities was created by the Decisions of the Councils of the European Economic Community and of the European Atomic Energy Community of 15 September 1958 (Official Journal No 17, 6.10.1958, pp. 390 and 419) . As of July 2013, only the electronic edition of the Official Journal published on EUR-Lex is authentic and produces legal effects. From 01 October 2023, the Official Journal is no longer a collation of acts with a table of contents. Each act is published individually as an authentic Official Journal in its PDF format. See

name: direct-access.html
text: the electronic edition of the Official Journal published on EUR-Lex is authentic and produces legal effects. From 01 October 2023, the Official Journal is no longer a collation of acts with a table of contents. Each act is published individually as an authentic Official Journal in its PDF format. See more in this video with a transcript ​ ​ . The Official Journal currently comprises 2 series: L – Legislation, with mostly EU secondary law (mainly regulations, directives, decisions, opinions, and recommendations) and international agreements C – Information and notices, containing preparatory acts, announcements, summaries of judgments of the Court of Justice of the European Union, annual reports of the European Court of Auditors, statements from the European Economic and Social Committee and the European Committee of the Regions, calls for expressions of interest for EU programmes and projects, etc. You can find more information on the Official Journal of the European Union (structure, series, special editions, authenticity, etc.) on the help pages . Legal basis for the publication of the Official Journal of the European Union: Article 191 of the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community Decision of the Council of the European Economic Community creating the Official Journal

name: direct-access.html
text: the European Union (structure, series, special editions, authenticity, etc.) on the help pages . Legal basis for the publication of the Official Journal of the European Union: Article 191 of the Treaty establishing the European Economic Community Decision of the Council of the European Economic Community creating the Official Journal of the European Communities of 15 September 1958 (Official Journal No 17, 6.10.1958, p.390) Decision of the Council of the European Atomic Energy Community creating the Official Journal of the European Communities of 15 September 1958 (Official Journal No 17, 6.10.1958, p.419) Council Regulation (EU) No 216/2013 of 7 March 2013 on the electronic publication of the Official Journal of the European Union (OJ L 69, 13.3.2013, p. 1).
